content:
Moved to IG creation at this link: https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/179252-IG-creation/topic/IG.20Build.20and.20canonical.20URL/near/170767382

I am working on an implementation guide for the September ballot. When I build, it builds the site at: ttp://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/cdisc-lab/index.html

According to Melva, I need to have the site at: http://hl7.org/fhir/cdisc-lab

Can you help me understand how to get this posted to the correct URL?

My canonical URL site in the ig.json is: http://hl7.org/fhir/cdisc-lab.

In the package-list.json file the URL specified there is: http://hl7.org/fhir/cdisc-lab/2019Sep.

Is 2019Sep correct? I saw other IGs that specified this so I added it.
@Lloyd McKenzie @Grahame Grieve @Nagesh Bashyam

the right place for this question is https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/179252-IG-creation. In terms of answers:
- the right canonical URL is either http://hl7.org/fhir/uv/cdisc-lab or http://hl7.org/fhir/us/cdisc-lab - where's the IG approval Wiki page? (can't look it up - connectivity is poor here)
- http://hl7.org/fhir/cdisc-lab/2019Sep = canonical + a particular version, and is probably wrong. Where does this show up?
- HQ (Lynn or I) actually publishes the content at the canonical location once it passes a myriad of tests, as laid out by Melva

@Grahame Grieve is that the TSC approval page? https://confluence.hl7.org/display/TSC/Project+Approval+Request+for+CDISC+Lab+Semantics+in+FHIR
It should be 'uv' according to the PSS, so we will change that. @Douglas Denney
no it's not the TSC approval - that's something else (you also need). The FMG approves the IG and must do so before you can publish for ballot - are you following Melva's checklist?
